intro: Vanwykia remota, commonly known as the remote vanwykia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
